instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no usb
threads.message:
so I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> who came in dead, missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, missing <CAPACITOR>C7588</CAPACITOR>, so I put it in, and machine is alive and working
after clean install of catalina, found that the left usb ( the built in board usb, not the charging port usb side) , doesnt work, 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_RTUSB_A_F</SIGNAL> is 3.3v, should be 5v isnt it ? this problem is very rare to me, any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no usb
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at L4605.
Also post all voltages of <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no usb
threads.message: sorry didn;t pay attention, there's missing <RESISTOR>R4600</RESISTOR>, solved now , thankss you may close this thread
